5 REASONS
TO FEED FROZEN/THAWED

  1. SAFE - Live prey will ultimately defend itself to the death if need be. Your pet is at risk of serious infection or possibly even death from bites and scratches.
  2. HUMANE - Death is not always quick and painless for the live prey item. Watching something struggle and fight for its life, is heartbreaking.
  3. SANITARY - Keeping live prey means cleaning up after live prey. Not to mention, freezing kills most parasites.
  4. ECONOMICAL - Proper housing, nutrition and upkeep for live prey can become costly and time consuming.
  5. CONVENIENT - A freezer full of food for your pet, ready to be thawed and fed off at any given moment, is a true luxury and concenince.

SAFETY FIRST!
AVOID LIVE FEEDINGS!

What is Gut Loading?

Gut loading is the process by which an animals prey is raised and fed nutritious foods with the intention of passing those nutrients to the animal for which the prey is intended.

Why is Gut Loading important?

Gut loading provides assurance that you are feeding your pet nutrient-dense insects which can help prevent serious issues from developing due to malnutrition. A calcium supplement should also be incorporated by "dusting" your prey with calcium and multivitamins prior to feeding your pet.
